quantityRules.description: Blue-tongue skinks are solitary and territorial. House individually only - minimum 75 gallons (48Ã—24Ã—18 inches).

lifespan: 15-20 years in captivity, up to 30 years with excellent care
setupTips: Provide large floor space - these are terrestrial and need room to roam
Use deep substrate (4-6 inches) for burrowing behavior
Include sturdy basking platform and multiple hides
notes: Diurnal and terrestrial - active during day on ground
Generally docile but can be defensive - may hiss and display blue tongue

warnings.message: UVB lighting essential for calcium metabolism and overall health. Use tube-style UVB 10.0.
Can deliver strong bite if threatened. Approach calmly and avoid sudden movements.
Prone to obesity - monitor portion sizes and provide varied diet with vegetables.

feedingRequirements: Omnivorous - 50% protein (insects, ground turkey, canned dog food), 50% vegetables and fruits
Provide variety - leafy greens, squash, berries, protein sources
feedingSchedule: Juveniles (0-12 months): Every other day, balanced diet
Adults (2+ years): 2 times weekly, monitor weight to prevent obesity
waterNotes: Provide large shallow water dish for drinking and soaking
Skinks often defecate in water - clean immediately
mistingNotes: Provide humid hide with damp moss for shedding
